alert.note: Alert for Cleveland (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 07 at 10:05AM CDT until June 07 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing. * WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Cleveland, Grady and McClain. * WHEN...Until 115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1003 AM CDT, Heavy rain due to thunderstorms have already occured. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Norman, Newcastle, Blanchard, Noble, Goldsby, Dibble, Washington, Cole, Criner, southwestern Lake Thunderbird and Payne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
